subject: RE: [junit] Re: can't catch exception... (more)
messageBody:
try catching Throwable...

> -----Original Message-----
> From: craig_comstock@... [mailto:craig_comstock@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 14, 2001 3:36 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Re: can't catch exception... (more)
>
>
> It throws Exception and a custom Exception class.
>
> --- In junit@y..., "Jason Rogers" <jason.rogers@t...> wrote:
> > What does getDataConn() throw?
> >
> > -Jason
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Craig Comstock [mailto:craig_comstock@y...]
> > > Sent: Thursday, June 14, 2001 3:19 PM
> > > To: junit@y...
> > > Subject: [junit] can't catch exception... (more)
> > >
> > >
> > > Sorry I included the wrong method...
> > >
> > > public String test() {
> > > IDataConn dc = null;
> > > System.out.println(this+".test() dc="+dc);
> > > try {
> > > System.out.println(this+" test() try");
> > > dc = m_AppLogic.getDataConn();
> > > System.out.println(this+" after getDataConn
> > > dc="+dc);
> > > } catch (Exception e) {
> > > System.out.println(this+" catch() e="+e);
> > > }
> > > System.out.println(this+" return dc="+dc);
> > > return ""+this+" dc="+dc;
> > > }
> > >
> > >
> > > Generally I get the System.out.println that prints
> > > "try", but nothing after that...
> > >
